body:

* Personally, I've developed and utilize my own straightforward extension adhering to the i18n standard, compatible with crowdin. This eliminates the need for duplicate keys, streamlining the writing process.

title: Feature: API for third-party applications to get Files tab‘s path
body:
### What feature or improvement do you think would benefit Files?

Is it possible for Files to add an API to get a tab's path? This will allow third-party applications to integrate with Files. For example, [Listary](https://www.listary.com/)'s [file application plugin](https://github.com/listary/Listary.FileAppPlugin) can get the folder opened in Files via this API, and then enable users to jump to the folder in file dialogs like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50246090/226175273-54af4d08-7277-4a22-b73d-ab9729aaf348.png)


### Requirements

The API can be implemented as a URL protocol or a CLI argument.

For example, it can follow the [x-callback-url specification](https://x-callback-url.com/):
```
files-uwp://x-callback-url/get-tab-path?x-success=myapp://x-callback-url
```
Or just add a CLI argument:
```powershell
> files.exe --active-tab-path
C:\Windows
```

### Files Version

Version: 2.4.54.0

### Windows Version

Windows 11 22H2 22621.1413

### Comments

title: Feature: Show pinned items in Folders Widget
body:
### What's the Problem?

`explorer.exe` can read custom folders from the registry. but the `files` app cannot.


The "项目" folder is a custom item and it was not show in `Files` app.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42184238/138536430-dcf80959-2442-4efd-a6c7-d9d9f39b231c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42184238/138536487-8fa460b5-850d-4ef9-8e2a-489be24ac2e9.png)


### Solution/Idea

It can get [`CLSID`](//docs.microsoft.com/windows/win32/com/clsid-key-hklm) items from Registry path `HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\MyComputer\NameSpace\` and `HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\MyComputer\NameSpace\`.

Then, go to the path `HKCR\CLSID\` and find `CLSID` item.
You can also use `HKCU\Software\Classes\CLSID\` and `HKLM\Software\Classes\CLSID\` to replace `HKCR\CLSID\`

The display name is the default value for `CLSID` item.
Icon is the default value for `DefaultIcon` item.
We can find folder path from item `Instance\InitPropertyBag` and key `Target`

See
- [Specifying a Namespace Extension's Location - Microsoft Docs](//docs.microsoft.com/windows/win32/shell/nse-junction)
- [Specifying a Namespace Extension's Location - Legacy Microsoft Docs](//docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/legacy/cc144096(v=vs.85))
- [How to create a System folder in My Computer in Windows 10 - technospot.net](//www.technospot.net/blogs/how-to-create-a-system-folder-in-my-computer/)

### Alternatives

The `Favorites` can replace it easy.

### Priorities

| Capability | Priority |
| :---------- | :------- |
| Show Folder Items. | Must |
| Show folder icon. | Should |
